key_risks: Environmental impact and transition challenges due to reliance on coal
Regulatory and legal risks, including disputes under the Energy Charter Treaty
Community and social opposition to renewable energy projects
Market competition in the renewable energy sector
controversies: Legal dispute with the Netherlands over coal transition
Community opposition to large-scale renewable energy projects
environmental_issues: Historical reliance on coal leading to deforestation and high carbon emissions
Challenges in meeting emission reduction targets
social_issues: Community resistance to renewable energy projects
Need for effective stakeholder engagement to mitigate opposition
governance_issues: Regulatory uncertainties impacting transition to renewable energy
Potential financial and operational impacts from legal disputes

sources.title: Environmental protection - RWE
sources.snippet: RWE has set Science-based Targets. These targets cover own operations as well as the entire value chain. The targets are based on the emission inventory calculated for the new RWE for the year 2019. The company is committed to reducing specific emissions from Scope 1 and 2 by 2030 by 50% to 296 g CO 2 e / kWh of electricity produced. Reference are emissions of 591 CO 2 e / kWh in 2019.

sources.title: Sustainability Report - RWE
sources.snippet: And our goals are clearly defined: RWE will be climate neutral by 2040 and move the full phase-out of coal in Germany forward to 2030.
